title: Publisher Rocket Tutorial - Boost your KDP Keyword Research

tactics.name: Publisher Rocket Keyword Research
tactics.description: Using Publisher Rocket to identify profitable niches and keywords by analyzing competition and categories
steps: Search keywords and filter by BSR and review counts
Use Amazon Ads keyword tools within the platform
caveats: May fail to surface niche opportunities if filters are too restrictive
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket brings up information so quickly and the reason I wanted to talk to you about it is because there's a really good special offer

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze niches by aggregating Amazon keyword data including competitors, earnings, and search volume.
steps: Enter a keyword into Publisher Rocket
Evaluate metrics: competitors, average monthly earnings, estimated searches
Filter for low competitive score (green) and high search volume
Review top-ranking books for cover inspiration and market trends
caveats: Estimated searches are algorithmic approximations, not exact Amazon data
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket gives you all the results on one page instead of chrome extensions

tactics.name: Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to discover untapped keyword ideas for book titles.
steps: Type a keyword into Publisher Rocket
caveats: May fail to show results for niche categories
source_quotes: this is how i would do my keyword search and i find that it actually usually gives me a lot of ideas

tactics.name: Competition Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate competitors using Publisher Rocket's competition analyzer tool.
steps: Input a keyword into competition analyzer
caveats: Does not account for non-Amazon platforms
source_quotes: it will give you a lot of information it actually pulls up 10 main competitors

tactics.name: Keyword Export for Ads
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to generate keywords for Amazon ads campaigns
steps: Export keyword results from Publisher Rocket
Run Amazon ads with low budget
Optimize keywords after 1 week of data collection
caveats: Tool may fail to identify long-tail keywords
source_quotes: get all of these results that you can then export and put in your amazon ads

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: Choosing smarter keywords and categories is a powerful way to get in front of more readers

heuristics.name: Competitive Score Filter
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is green (low) and estimated searches are high, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: Competitive score if it's green that means it's okay it's a good score

heuristics.name: Review Count Optimization
source_quotes: you can also see that it targets some of the guest books that are already on amazon

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket is effective for all Amazon book types, not just low-content books
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket is not just for low content books it's for all books on amazon

claims.statement: Amazon does not provide direct search volume data, but Publisher Rocket estimates it using modified Google data
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't give that information to anybody but Publisher Rocket has a really clever algorithm

claims.statement: Amazon uses bisac categories and browse categories for book classification.
source_quotes: amazon shows your books in the browse categories those browse categories are for the buyers

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket provides lifetime access with no subscription fees
source_quotes: it's a one-time payment and publisher rocket is yours and you can use it all the time

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience identities with clear problems and constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines demographic targeting with niche problem-solving
source_quotes: I discovered some of the niches that I wouldn't have discovered doing the manual research

niche_patterns.description: Target specific use cases with material preferences to differentiate in competitive niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines functional need (event) with physical preference (material) for unique positioning
source_quotes: Guestbook for funerals the searches are a bit lower it's still not a bad niche
